intro: Chisocheton cumingianus subsp. balansae, commonly known as the Balansae chisocheton, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval, yellowish fruits. It is often found in lowland and hill forest ecosystems, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the understory. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
